BCCI invites bids to become Indian teams' title sponsors; what's allowed, what's not
description: Following Dream11's exit due to the real money gaming ban, the BCCI seeks a new title sponsor for the Indian cricket team. Bids are invited, excluding companies involved in real money gaming, cryptocurrency, tobacco, and alcohol. The deadline for submissions is September 16.

Asia Cup: How much do tickets for India vs Pak match cost? How to buy tickets?
description: Asia Cup 2025 ticket sales have officially commenced on Platinumlist, offering fans a chance to secure their seats for the tournament in Dubai and Abu Dhabi. Several package options are available, including group-stage matches, Super Four contests, and the final, alongside individual match tickets. The competition gets underway on September 9.

Pakistan vs Afghanistan Live Score Streaming, 4th T20I Tri-Series: When and where to watch PAK vs AFG match today?
Afghanistan earthquake: Death toll crosses 1,400; rescuers scramble for survivors
description: A devastating 6.0 magnitude earthquake in eastern Afghanistan has claimed over 1,400 lives and injured more than 3,100, according to a Taliban government spokesman. The quake, which struck late Sunday, destroyed thousands of homes in Kunar province. Rescue efforts are hampered by difficult terrain.

'Head of anaconda': Ashwin hits out at Lalit Modi over Harbhajan-Sreesanth slapgate video
description: Ravichandran Ashwin has criticized Lalit Modi and Michael Clarke for circulating an old video of the 2008 IPL 'slapgate' incident involving Harbhajan Singh and S. Sreesanth. Ashwin emphasized the importance of moving on from past mistakes, noting that Harbhajan and Sreesanth have already reconciled. The resurfaced footage has been widely condemned, including by Sreesanth's wife, for reigniting a settled controversy.

2020 Delhi riots case: HC rejects bail pleas of Sharjeel Imam, Umar Khalid, 7 others
description: The Delhi High Court has dismissed the bail pleas of Sharjeel Imam, Umar Khalid, and seven others in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots larger conspiracy case. The prosecution argued the violence was a planned conspiracy to defame India, not spontaneous riots.

New AI-powered stethoscope developed by UK doctors can detect heart problems ‘in seconds’
BRS suspends K Kavitha: Why KCR removed daughter from party; family feud explained
description: K Kavitha, daughter of K Chandrashekar Rao, has been suspended from the BRS after publicly criticising her cousins, T Harish Rao and Santosh Kumar, for allegedly tarnishing her father's image in connection with the Kaleshwaram project. Weeks before, Kavitha was removed as honorary president of the Telangana Boggu Gani Karmika Sangham. Kavitha said it was a political conspiracy as the internal crisis was deepening.

title: BRS suspends K Kavitha from party – with KCR ‘blessing’ – day after she lashed out at cousin
Delhi riots ‘larger conspiracy’ case: HC refuses bail to accused Tasleem Ahmed
House of Cards star Robin Wright leaves the US for the UK: ‘People are kind here, America is a s*** show’
England vs South Africa 1st ODI Live Score Streaming: When and where to watch ENG vs SA match today?
PM Modi likely to visit Mizoram, Manipur on Sept 13
Yamuna threatens Delhi: Floodwaters enter homes; traffic advisory issued
description: The Yamuna River in Delhi has breached the danger mark due to continuous heavy rainfall, leading to waterlogging and flooding in areas like Mayur Vihar. Authorities have closed the Old Iron Bridge and are conducting rescue operations in Burari, evacuating stranded farmers. Shopkeepers in Civil Lines are taking precautions due to rising water levels.

title: Amrit Bharat Station Scheme: Redevelopment of Jaipur railway station in progress, to handle about 1.75 lakh passengers daily

'Anti-party conduct': BRS suspends K Kavitha - what party said
description: Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) suspended MLC K Kavitha, daughter of KCR, following her public criticism of senior leaders. Kavitha accused T. Harish Rao and J. Santosh Kumar of corruption and tarnishing KCR's image, particularly concerning the Kaleshwaram irrigation project. She alleged their involvement in misdeeds that have defamed her father.

title: Karnataka man murders daughter, a nursing student, over inter-caste relationship
Meet Kittammal V: TN grandma breaking powerlifting records, praised by Anand Mahindra
description: Anand Mahindra lauded Kittammal V, an 82-year-old powerlifter from Tamil Nadu, for her remarkable achievements in state-level competitions. Defying age stereotypes, she inspires many by outperforming younger athletes with her dedication to fitness and a traditional South Indian diet. Her story highlights the importance of resilience and challenges conventional views on aging in India.

title: Abuse row: PM Modi’s emotional outburst against RJD & Congress - 'what did my mother do?'
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi responded strongly to alleged abuses against his late mother during a Congress-RJD rally in Bihar, stating it insulted all women. He expressed that the people of Bihar shared his pain and condemned the remarks. Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar also criticized the incident, calling the language used against PM Modi and his mother "utterly deplorable."

title: 'Little bit of geopolitical issues': Goyal says India-US trade deal likely 'by Nov or so'
description: India and the US are currently engaged in negotiations for a Bilateral Trade Agreement, despite recent tariff impositions by the US and concerns over India's trade relations with Russia. India has set firm boundaries, particularly regarding its agricultural and dairy sectors.

title: Discount grows: Russian crude gets even cheaper for India; New Delhi continues to resist US pressure
description: India is facing increased pressure from the US over its growing Russian oil imports, leading to a 50% tariff imposed by the Trump administration. Despite widening discounts on Russian Urals crude, making it cheaper than US alternatives, the US accuses India of funding Russia's war in Ukraine through these purchases.

title: 'Put it in container': Pak defence minister’s solution for floods; calls excess water 'blessing'
description: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif suggested citizens store floodwater as a blessing amid severe flooding in Punjab province, which has claimed 33 lives and displaced over 700,000 residents. Punjab is experiencing its biggest flood in history, impacting two million people and threatening food security due to crop damage. Monsoon rains have been excessive, leading to widespread devastation across the country.

title: 'One-sided' trade myth: Why Donald Trump is wrong - How US profits big from India
description: Donald Trump's claims of a disastrous trade relationship with India are challenged by a GTRI analysis, revealing a $35-40 billion surplus for the US when considering all earnings. The US benefits significantly from tech, finance, and education sectors in India. India's proposed tariff concessions are generous, and its decisions on oil and defence are based on national interests.

title: Exclusive | 'I tried to live as a man but': First-ever trans chess player to reach WIM
description: Yosha Iglesias, once a chess prodigy in Sochi, Russia, has made history as the first transgender woman to win the French women's chess championship. Overcoming personal struggles, including a difficult transition and online harassment, Yosha found strength in her chess community and Buddhist philosophy. Her journey, marked by resilience and self-acceptance, inspires others to embrace their true selves.

title: Youngest woman billionaire on leaving college: Parents reaction; money lessons
description: Lucy Guo, the world's youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her early entrepreneurial spirit to her frugal upbringing. Despite her parents' emphasis on academics, she dropped out of Carnegie Mellon to pursue the Thiel Fellowship. Guo's childhood hustles, from selling Pokémon cards to creating online gaming tools, laid the foundation for her success with companies like Scale AI and Passes.

title: Trademark fight in India: Bombay HC to Cognizant; You cannot use logo till case ends
description: The Bombay High Court has reinstated a ban on Cognizant's use of its logo in India, pending the resolution of a trademark infringement lawsuit filed by Atyati Technologies. This decision overturns a previous order that had allowed Cognizant to continue using the logo.

title: Micah Parsons FaceTimes heartbroken Cowboys fan, vows to make him proud
description: After a shocking trade sent Micah Parsons to the Green Bay Packers, a young Cowboys fan's emotional reaction went viral. Parsons responded with empathy, FaceTiming the child, offering encouragement, and promising a Packers jersey. Green Bay then signed Parsons to a record-breaking contract, setting the stage for his return to Dallas as a Packer.

title: Paulina Gretzky stuns in gothic look on Italy trip with Dustin Johnson
description: Paulina Gretzky, daughter of Wayne Gretzky and wife of Dustin Johnson, is making waves with her daring all-black ensemble during her Italian getaway. Showcasing her evolving style on the LTK app, Gretzky's look features a mix of edgy and luxury pieces, including a Helsa Poplin Bra and Bottega Veneta mules.

title: Brittany Mahomes: Some women are disrespectful pursuing Patrick
description: Brittany Mahomes, wife of NFL star Patrick Mahomes, has addressed her past insecurities regarding attention from other women towards her husband. She admitted that disrespectful behavior from some women used to bother her. However, Brittany has grown to a point where she is unbothered and focused on her family with Patrick, whom she met in high school.

title: Meta Al reshuffle: Head Alexandr Wang sends memo to staff; Makes one thing clear
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intensifying the AI race by reorganizing Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) into four specialized teams under Alexandr Wang's leadership. This restructuring aims to accelerate the pursuit of "personal superintelligence," consolidating research, product development, and infrastructure efforts. Key leaders like Nat Friedman and Aparna Ramani will play crucial roles in this ambitious endeavor.
